extendedInfo.description: The Fetal Kick Count is a simple and effective way for mothers to monitor the well being of their babies in pregnancy.It is recommended by most Obstetricians. Mothers are encouraged to monitor the kicks of their babies after 28 weeks of pregnancy on a daily basis till delivery. At least 10 fetal kicks should be felt within a maximum duration of 12 hours. This generally indicates that the baby is well. This easy to use Android Fetal Kick Count Application provides many advantages over the conventional way of recording the fetal kicks, one of which is the ability to record the movements wherever you are e.g. at work, in the supermarket, at home.

reviews.title: Did nothing
reviews.comment: The app wouldn\'t register not one kick.... G2.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Did not work at all.
reviews.comment: I kept pushing the kick button but nothing registered.
reviews.author: Christy Storrs

reviews.title: Dumb
reviews.comment: App wouldn\'t work on my droid, waste of time.
reviews.author: Rachel Saito

reviews.title: Only 10 kicks recorded
reviews.comment: Basic, easy, but wish I could record more kicks than just 10.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Where? What? How? Have to read instructions first, but where is it?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No options
reviews.comment: This app would be great if I could decide what time I want to monitor my baby\'s kicks, 9 am is arbitrary and useless to me.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.comment: Did nothing would not let me use the app
reviews.author: Alyssa Martinez

reviews.title: Could be better
reviews.comment: My baby moves before 9a and even more after 9p, but this won\'t let you record those movements. Drove me nuts.
reviews.author: Sarah Forgie

reviews.title: Low count
reviews.comment: It only let me count to 10 each day, I wanna know how many all day. Not just the first couple hrs after I wake up
reviews.author: Vicky Emmett
